title: When should I start playing ranked?
body: I've hit level 30 and therefore can start playing ranked. I know if I went in now it would be disastrous, but how long should I wait before playing? I've got over 100 regular wins under my belt so I was thinking perhaps another 100 more before I start?

replies.body:
Well here's wat i did to get a feel of ranked:

1) Pre-season i yoloed it, people dont really play 'Serious' enough during pre-season, so i did pre-season pretty well Silver 5 :D
2) When the season starts, be careful of when ur playing! Take the time to try and main all lanes then u wont rage and feed like an ass cause u didn't get lane
3) Start ranked when ur confident enough, not when ur depressed, your emotions will affect ur play, believe all the people on the boards <3

That's really all i got. OH and if u get into bronze 5, just yolo it, seriously, yolo all of ur ranked games, i did it, got out asap, aka 1 day, but as soon as ur in bronze 4 play serious, remember the toxic crap in bronze 5 :/

What I recommend so you don't (Mostly) get people getting mad at you.
------------------------------------------------
Get Minimum of 3 rune pages.
AD-
AP-
Tank etc-

I have 14.
AD top - AP top.
Ad Jungle - Ap jungle
etc.
-------------------------------------------------------
MINIMUM of 500 norm wins.
this should give you the basic experience.

Try and play every champion at least once (Even if its a bot game)
so that why you know what there passives are and what they can/cant do.

-----

Play every role a bot, doesn't hurt to main one. But make sure you can do anything.
I.E  I main support - top but can easily do any other role.

-----

Get at least 3 champions in every role.
I.E (For me)
Top- Gnar-Lissandra-Olaf-Pantheon-Teemo(hue)
Jungle- Rammus-Amumu-Vi-Fiddle-Skarner
Mid- Azir-Xerath-Ziggs-Syndra
Support- Braum-Sona-Leo-Nami-thresh
Marksman- Twitch-Sivir-Cait

-----

Always fucking ward, and dont forget to upgrade your trinket.
Work on getting a positive KDA.

-------

Until you get those, don't do rank.

Ty,
lol
but no.

There's no such "minimum number of games" and it is more when you feel like you're ready to take on enemy players in a more competitive manner
If you can play a couple of champions in a couple of lanes, you're good to go
Honestly, it's more about how well you can play against the match ups but you should never feel anxious because you'll make mistakes you don't normally make. Furthermore, don't play cautiously thinking its more important. Ranked is just like normal so don't pressure yourself :)

I would recommend playing normals and finding champs you are good at and getting to a level you're happy with
Good luck and hopefully see you on the rift :)

At the moment i main top or in the jungle. But i can play every other lane, especially lately I've been playing mid a lot with Ahri and Jayce. I may play one ranked game soon to see how I go, but I dont want to get belted and then be turned off it.

Anyways ty for the advice! :)

Good luck mate!
Remember, don't pick champions you think are going to counter the enemy if you've never played them! Just play your best on the champions you know and you will most likely do better :)
wen u git gud

a bronze 5 player in lane could beat you just simply because more experience. it would be far better for you to continue to play norms for a while. try to avoid being "ranked" for ages. if you do that you'll most likely avoid bronze and silver and drop in at a higher elo. much easier to have a high elo if you've never been ranked before. making it easier to be gold which is the goal for most people.

Don't ever start, you play ranked and have to enjoy playing with people who lose their lane so hard 10 mins into the game that it becomes a mountain only a pro player could conquer. By the way you wont start Bronze v, unranked play mostly high silver and low gold, hence why it is the most frustrating elo.
Play normals until you can single handedly stomp your games then come in and win 10/10 in your placements and get straight into gold, otherwise you just play ranked to watch morons throw games and you can play really well and not be rewarded.

You just jump into it when the time is right for you

Just make sure you have enough rune pages and can play champs comfortably. As well as having a basic idea of whats required for every role, because there will be times when you're unable to get your preferred role.

its not a matter of how many wins you have, its about having enough champs and knowing at least one champ in each role , and having enough runes that you are not at a huge disadvantage.
even if you get put into bronze 5 , you can learn and climb, you dont have to wait till you are silver/gold tier player to start ranked , you can start at the bottom if you wish thats kinda why bronze 5 is there.
as long as you got rune pages set and you know at least 1 champ in every position jump right into it.
